# Univariate distributions

Univariate summary CRASH-2 dataset 

```{r, message =FALSE, warning =FALSE , echo=FALSE}
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(Hmisc)
source(here("R", "ida_plot_univar.R"))
```


```{r load_crash2, message = FALSE, echo=FALSE}
## Load the dataset.
load(here::here("data", "crash2.rda"))
```

```{r}
## TODO: Move out to data prep
## Complete metadata by adding missing labels. 
crash2 <- Hmisc::upData(crash2,
               labels = c(age = 'Age'),
               units = c(age = "years"))
```



### Describe the dataset

Use Hmisc describe function. 

```{r desc_crash2, message = FALSE, results='asis', warning=FALSE, , echo=FALSE}
crash2 %>%
  Hmisc::describe(descript = "Crash2 data set") %>%
  Hmisc::html()
```


## Univariate summary

### Continous variables

#### Age


Plot age. 



```{r, fig.width=8, fig.height=3.5, fig.cap= "Distribution of subject age [years]" , echo=FALSE}
ida_plot_univar(crash2, "age", n_dodge = 1)
```


#### Blood pressure

Plot blood pressure. 

```{r, fig.width=8, fig.height=3.5, fig.cap= "Distribution of SBP" , echo=FALSE}
ida_plot_univar(crash2, "sbp", n_dodge = 1)
```



#### RR


```{r, fig.width=8, fig.height=3.5, fig.cap= "Distribution of respiratory rate" , echo=FALSE}
ida_plot_univar(crash2, "rr", n_dodge = 2)
```


#### RR


```{r, fig.width=8, fig.height=3.5, fig.cap= "Distribution of heart rate", echo=FALSE}
ida_plot_univar(crash2, "hr", n_dodge = 1)
```
